greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0, and for n > 0, a(n+1) = k^2 - a(n) where k is the number of terms equal to a(n) among the first n terms.
comment: In other words, for n > 0, a(n+1) = o(n)^2 - a(n) where o is the ordinal transform of the sequence.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Rémy Sigrist, Scatterplot of the first 2^20 terms
